db:info.db:title: Qt Quick 2 Multiple Graphs Example
db:info.db:edition: Qt Data Visualization | Commercial or GPLv3

db:abstract.db:para: Showing multiple graphs simultaneously in a QML application.

db:article.db:para: The Qt Quick 2 multiple graphs example demonstrates using multiple graphs in single window.

The interesting thing about this example is demonstrating that multiple graphs can be used simultaneously, so most functionality is not explained in detail. For more detailed QML example documentation, see Qt Quick 2 Scatter Example.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Multiple Graphs
db:section.db:para: Using multiple graphs in a single application doesn't require anything special, simply define and position the graphs as normal. In this example the graphs are shown in a 2 x 2 grid with GridLayout:
Each graph has a parent Rectangle item to provide it with a border.
Note that one of the grid cells is used for buttons in an another GridLayout.
